flush.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to become red in the face, for example when you are angry or embarrassed
flush.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Susan flushed deeply and looked away.
Robyn felt her cheeks flush scarlet.
flush.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if you flush a toilet, or if it flushes, you make water go through it to clean it
flush.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Why do children never remember to flush the loo?
She flushed the rest of her drink down the toilet.
flush.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to force water through a pipe in order to clean it
flush.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: They flush clean water through the pipes once a day.
flush.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a red colour that appears on your face when you are angry or embarrassed
flush.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: His words brought a warm flush to her face.
flush.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the part of a toilet that cleans it with a sudden flow of water
flush.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: the act of cleaning a toilet by forcing water through it
flush.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: a set of cards that someone has in a card game that are all of the same suit
flush.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: if two surfaces are flush, they are at exactly the same level, so that the place where they meet is flat
flush.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Make sure that the cupboard is flush with the wall.
flush.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: if someone is flush, they have plenty of money to spend
flush.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: I’m feeling flush at the moment.
flush.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to have a lot of money at a particular time
flush.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Singapore’s savings rate is so high that the banks are flush with funds.
The group is flush and has been making more acquisitions.
flush.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: to be very successful, and keen to achieve more success
flush.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: Flushed by success in selling homes in the slump, developers now plan to do the same in the commercial property sector.
flush.translation[3].definitions[2].exam: You can get a dealer who is a busted flush at 30.
